reference.title: subjectHead
reference.shortdesc: The <subjectHead> element provides a heading for a group of subjects, for use if the scheme is displayed. For instance, a scheme may be displayed to let a user select subjects as part of faceted browsing. The subjectHead element itself does not reference a file and cannot be referenced as a key, so it does not define any controlled values.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

example.title: Example
example.p: In this example the “Server setup” label doesn't classify content but, when selected, is equivalent to the union of its child subjects. That is, the heading covers content about planning for any application, installing for any application, any task for web servers, or any task for database servers.
example.codeblock: <subjectScheme toc="yes" search="no"> ... <subjectHead> <subjectHeadMeta> <navtitle>Server setup</navtitle> </subjectHeadMeta> <subjectdef href="planningTaskType.dita"/> <subjectdef href="installingTaskType.dita"/> <subjectdef href="webServerApp.dita"/> <subjectdef href="databaseApp.dita"/> </subjectHead> ... </subjectScheme>
